meanings.definition: An instrument for determining altitude attained, especially a barometric or radar device used in aircraft.
meanings.sent1: Pilots rely on altimeters to know how high they are flying.
meanings.sent2: The altimeters in the cockpit help the pilot navigate through different altitudes.
meanings.sent3: The altimeters at the airshow were having a competition to see who could reach the highest reading.
meanings.sent4: Her ambition soared like the readings on altimeters, reaching new heights every day.
meanings.sent5: The altimeters hummed softly, whispering the altitude to the attentive pilot.

meanings.definition: A device for measuring altitude, typically used in aviation.
meanings.sent1: The hikers used altimeters to track their progress up the mountain.
meanings.sent2: Aviation experts always carry altimeters to ensure safe flying.
meanings.sent3: The altimeters at the airport had a race to see who could measure the highest altitude.
meanings.sent4: His determination was like the needle on altimeters, always pointing upwards.
meanings.sent5: The altimeters beeped in unison, indicating the plane's ascent into the sky.
